column3: Alectoris graeca PacBio HiFi WGS data
column9: The HiFi library was constructed using the “Preparing whole genome and metagenome libraries using SMRTbell prep kit 3.0” (PN 102-166-600 (April 2022)) from PacBio. DNA was sheared on a Megaruptor 3 (Diagenode) instrument to a target size of 15-20 kb, followed by QC on a Femto Pulse instrument (Agilent). DNA repair, ligation of SMRTbell adapters, post-ligation clean-up and size selection were performed to create a sequencing library. Primer annealing and polymerase binding were performed on the library using the Revio polymerase kit (PN 102-739-100). Finally, one SMRTcell 25M was sequenced on the PacBio Revio System.

column3: Alectoris graeca Illumina Hi-C data kidney
column9: Hi-C library was created as described in the Dovetail Omni-C Kit USER GUIDE v2.0 and library QC was performed using the Qubit dsDNA HS Assay kit and the Agilent High Sensitivity/DNA 12000 DNA Kit.

column3: Alectoris graeca Illumina Hi-C data blood
column9: Hi-C library was created as described in the Dovetail Omni-C Kit USER GUIDE v2.0 and library QC was performed using the Qubit dsDNA HS Assay kit and the Agilent High Sensitivity/DNA 12000 DNA Kit.

column3: Alectoris graeca Illumina RNA-Seq data kidney
column9: The RNA sequencing library is prepared using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA Library Preparation Kit with poly-A selection (cat# 20020595, Illumina Inc.). Library preparation is performed according to the manufacturer's protocol (#1000000040498). Before library preparation, the quality and quantity of the samples are evaluated using either the Fragment Analyzer system (DNF-471 kit) or the TapeStation 4200 (RNA ScreenTape), both systems from Agilent Technologies.
